intro: Xanthosoma nangaritzense, commonly known as the Nangaritzé arrowleaf, is a species of flowering plant in the Araceae family. It is native to the Andean region of South America, specifically Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a waxy coating. It produces clusters of small, greenish-white flowers surrounded by a spathe, typical of the Araceae family. Xanthosoma nangaritzense is adapted to grow in humid, shaded environments, often in forest understories.
